intro: Galium surinamense, commonly known as Surinam bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Galium surinamense is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests, where it plays a role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
